column5: Going up to Reindeer lake in June. Would love to hear from anyone who was up there on what worked well, what to expect in terms of tatics and anything you have to add that you feel would be invaluable.Thanks Kurt
Where exactly are you going, I'm going also in June. We're going to camp about six miles from the south end of the lake. Use any thing BIG for the pike and lakers. Eight inches or more.
We are going to Trout Lake Camp arriving on 6/24/01. Really looking forward to it.

I was up there thefirst 2 weeks in June of 93 not at trout lake we camped about 6 mi. west of there. We were a little early for pike but the lakers were shallow. We walked in to a small lake some locals told us about and we were catching 100's of walleye a day between 2 and 5 lbs.There was a boat there with Trout Lake on it so I know they know about it. I'd say 3 of us caught well over 1000 walleyes in 4 days out of that lake! My dad has the maps if you'd like I could give you more dettailed instruchens on where it is let me know.
A map with directions would be great, you can e-mail me at [email protected]. Thanks
